resources.string: Scene was not found where this answer leads to. Check that your answer leads to a correct scene in this scenario.
Oh snap, it did not go so well this time. Try again with better luck and weigh your answers thoroughly.
Nice! You succeeded on this scenario pretty well, but you can still do better.
Awesome! You got all the answers correct.
You can only move your own crated scenarios in to this category!
Percentage will be reset back to 0\%. Are you sure you want to do this?
Scenario will be deleted permanently. Are you sure you want to do this?
Are you sure you want to delete this permanently?
Update added new scenarios and one of the scenarios has the same name as your own created scenario \"%1$s\". Rename your created scenario to something else, otherwise it will not work correctly.
The name of the first scene must be: first
You can\'t rename the first scene!
Select where does this answer lead to:
Ensure that you have given all the data
Do you really want remove this?
You can delete scenes by holding the scene button
You can delete answers by holding the answer button
You must give a name to the scene.
You must give a question to the scene.
You must create at least one answer.
Only one scene can name to first
You must give a name to the scene!
You have already created scene named \"%1$s\"! Please rename your scene.

Creating a scenario

1. Give name to your scenario (name must be unique)

2. Press the \"&create_scene;\" button to add scenes to your scenario

3. When scenario is ready press the \"&add;\" button

&export_file;

You can export your created scenario as a json file by pressing the \"&export_file;\" button and by selecting where to export your scenario.

&import_file;

It is also possible to import json scenario files in to your app, just press the \"&import_file;\" button and select the file to import.

Deleting, moving and duplicating scenes

If you want to delete, move or duplicate created scenes, just hold the created scene button.

Creating a scene

1. Select your desired image for the scene

2. Give name to your scene (the name must be unique and first scene must be named "first")

3. Write a question to your scene

4. Create at least one answer to your scene by clicking the \"&create_answer;\" button

5. When the scene is ready press the \"&done;\" button

Deleting, moving and duplicating answer

If you want to delete, move or duplicate created answers, just hold the created answer button.

Creating an answer

1. Select a color to your answer

2. Write an answer

3. Select to what scene does this answer lead to

4. When the answer is ready press the \"&done;\" button

Meaning of colors: Green is the desired answer, yellow is almost right and red is not so good answer.

Note:

If you delete or rename scenes and some of the answers led to that scene, remember to go and change where those answers lead to.

Credits

Realistic Life Simulator is produced by software engineering students of Tampere University of Applied Sciences, together with the “Services of the Nepsy Youth to the Rise” working group coordinated by the Nepsy support team of City of Tampere. The working group has included the staff from the City of Tampere in a multidisciplinary manner, experience experts and members of the Autism Association of the Region of Tampere. Client is the City of Tampere.

www.tampere.fi/nepsy
